text: Lucía García Córdoba (; born 14 July 1998) is a Spanish professional football forward currently playing for Athletic Club in the Spanish First Division. ==Career== ===Club career=== García made her debut in first division with Oviedo Moderno at the age of 15, later signing for Athletic Bilbao when she was 18. ===International=== García made her debut match for the senior national team on 2 March 2018 against Belgium. In 2019, she was called up for the World Cup. García scored the third goal in Spain's 3–1 win against South Africa. {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="7"|Lucía García – goals for Spain |- ! # !! Date !! Location !! Opponent !! Score !! Result !! Competition |- |align=center| 1. || 8 June 2019 || Le Havre, France || ||align=center| 3–1 ||align=center| 3–1 || 2019 FIFA World Cup |- |align="center"| 2. || rowspan=2|5 March 2020 || rowspan=2|Exploria Stadium, Orlando, Florida || rowspan=2| ||align="center"| 2–1 ||rowspan=2 align="center"| 3–1 ||rowspan=2| 2020 SheBelieves Cup |- |align="center"| 3. || align=center|3–1 |} ==Personal== García was born in Barakaldo, Basque Country as her mother looked for a hospital specialising in multiple births. She spent her early life in Aller, Asturias, as the only female in a set of quadruplets. García has stated that none of her brothers were interested in football while they were growing up. ==Honours== ===International=== *UEFA Women's Under-17 Championship: 2015, Runner-Up: 2016 *UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship: 2017 ==Notes== ==References== ==External links== * *Lucía Garcia at Liga de Fútbol Profesional Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Spanish women's footballers Category:Primera División (women) players Category:Sportspeople from Barakaldo Category:Asturian footballers Category:Women's association football forwards Category:Spain women's international footballers Category:Athletic Club Femenino players Category:People from Aller, Asturias Category:Basque footballers Category:Quadruplets Category:Twin sportspeople Category:Twin people from Spain Category:2019 FIFA Women's World Cup players
title: Lucía García
